data.title: [json] No code assist in schema property in settings.json
Focus should not reach <body>

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing #2145

`setInterval(function() { console.log(document.activeElement); }, 2000);`
- put last editor in Tab moves focus mode via `Ctrl+M`
- tab in last editor:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/12581676/76244de8-c438-11e5-858f-d39b2acef3f5.png)

data.title: Migrating auto-save settings sometimes produces an incorrect user json
data.body:
1. Have an empty user.json
2. Make vscode migrate your auto-save setting (describe in #1854)
3. Notice that automatically adding a property to the user json produces an incorrect .json file if the user json was empty - a not needed comma is added

![screen shot 2016-01-26 at 14 20 47](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/12581636/4746f106-c438-11e5-8151-415b38733f44.png)

data.title: Focus indication in non-active viewlet icons is waaaay too subtle
data.body:
Testing #2145

You should be able to tell where focus is in a glimpse in the following screenshot. IMHO if it takes more than 2s it's too subtle:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/12581585/e96d3388-c437-11e5-8769-3bafa60498ed.png)

And here's a gif:
![focus-move-subtle](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/12581605/11be58c6-c438-11e5-8ad5-f561a5e3e379.gif)

data.title: [json] Inline schema in settings don't work
IntelliSense: Moving through elements with comments causes flicker

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: When you arrow down the result list, there is ugly flickering in the IntelliSense widget.

data.title: OSS README in TypeScript extension needs to be updated
data.body:
We now get the tmGrammars from `https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript-TmLanguage`

``` json
    "name": "typescript-sublime-plugin",
    "version": "0.1.8",
    "license": "Apache2",
    "repositoryURL": "https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript-Sublime-Plugin",
    "description": "The files syntaxes/TypeScript.tmLanguage and syntaxes/TypeScriptReact.tmLanguage were derived from the TypeScript-Sublime-Plugin https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript-Sublime-Plugin.",
    "licenseDetail": [
```

data.title: IntelliSense window leaves the editor when it should open to the top
data.body:
I had the panel open and triggered IntelliSense in the lower area of the editor. I would expect the widget to position to the top to not draw under the panel:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/12581528/6e5fb724-c437-11e5-9bde-8f6736b36654.png)

data.title: Salsa support doesn't work with 1.9.x version of typescript
data.body: found while testing #2218

data.title: no migration path for vscode.d.ts installation
data.body: We have a story as outlined here: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/1881 but there is no migration path for existing users. We should provide a way to modify the `package.json` to include the needed script.

data.title: OS X: using the Pinyin input method results in internal error
data.body:
when testing #2250 on OS X:
- in System Preference/Keyboard/Input Sources add input method "Chinese Simplified"/''Pinyin - Simplified"
- make Pinyin the current input method
- type a + b + space
  Observe: an internal error occurs:
  ![2016-01-26 13-05-31](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/12580180/a7ff6b46-c42d-11e5-9d74-0a6163ca47b7.png)

If the crash doesn't occur immediately, just keep typing...

data.title: [json] No code complete for $schema property name

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- create an empty JSON file

``` json
{
    "$sch<code complete>"
}
```

Observe: no code complete is offered.

Close really means `go back` and not `close` in this case:

data.body:
- `large_files\result - Copy.js`
- go to last line
- click around

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/12579519/cf6259a0-c428-11e5-9b97-fd3aa1ccc394.png)

data.title: machineId not passed to welcome site on first startup if telemetry.machineId deleted
data.body:
I see this on linux, with default browser chrome
- from storage delete `workbench.hide.welcome` and `telemetry.machineid`
- reload code -> notice browser window has ID `undefined`
- In vscode I see the `telemetry.machineID` set, but it must be set too late, so it is not passed to the browser

![screen shot 2016-01-26 at 12 27 48](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/12579430/3d9835b2-c428-11e5-9901-2e58de78e89a.png)

data.title: Json hover should Loading... only when hovring string value without description
data.body:
``` json
{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "command": "tsc",
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "isWatching": true,
    "showOutput": "always",
    "args": [
        "--watch"
    ],
    "problemMatcher": {
        "base": "$tsc-watch"
    }
}
```
- Hover over "--watch"

Observer: all you see is Loading...

data.title: Debug hover: Show after delay

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: I find the current behavior of showing the hover instantly when mouse is over way too hectic, especially that the hover is now so large. I suggest to really show it only after a delay.

data.title: Would like to see the changed value indication in the Watch pane as well
data.body:
Testing #2171

pls see the title.

data.title: Debug hover: does not seem to work so well when in file inlined from source map

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I am debugging an extension and I step into code from the plugin host, which now nicely works and shows the source code from the source map! However, the debug hover only seems to work on the current active line, not when I move around in the editor.

![hover](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/12579069/62fd5dda-c425-11e5-8fda-ea2640411c4b.gif)

data.title: 'Accessibility mode on'  not persisted across VSCode sessions
data.body:
- Turn on 'Use tab key for setting focus'
- Restart vscode
- This setting is not persisted, so a user that uses accessibility would need to turn this on every startup

data.title: Horizontal panel cannot be dragged up again
data.body:
- select the drag-element for the horizontal panel
- keep the move pressed, move all the way below the status bar
- while still keeping the mouse pressed move up again
  :arrow_right: you don't get the panel back

data.title: Weird flashing marker when clicking around in debug
data.body:
I am in a breakpoint and suddenly I get this:

![hover](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/12578790/77165242-c423-11e5-9e2a-51a0664cbf88.gif)

data.title: 'Accessibility mode on' not persisted when new editor opened
data.body:
- Turn on 'Use tab for setting focus'
- Open a new split editor - notice that this one does not have accessibility mode on
- I would expect this mode is persisted accross editors

data.title: Horizontal panel separator look bogus
data.body:
I don't understand why it uses the status bar background color and that it even changes when debugging. It should use a more similar style as the sidebar does (background et al) and not look like an editor 

![screen shot 2016-01-26 at 11 41 49](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1794099/12578719/1196db76-c423-11e5-80f3-adb1f9ac60f6.png)

data.title: Titles are aligned towards the bottom
data.body:
